definitions.text: issue a ticket or a fine to as a penalty
examples: I was fined for parking on the wrong side of the street
Move your car or else you will be ticketed!

definitions.text: being satisfactory or in satisfactory condition
examples: the passengers were shaken up but are all right
dinner and the movies had been fine
another minute I'd have been fine

definitions.text: minutely precise especially in differences in meaning
characterized by elegance or refinement or accomplishment
examples: looking fine in her Easter suit
the fine hand of a master

definitions.text: of textures that are smooth to the touch or substances consisting of relatively small particles
examples: batiste is a cotton fabric with a fine weave
covered with a fine film of dust

definitions.text: free from impurities; having a high or specified degree of purity
an expression of agreement normally occurring at the beginning of a sentence
